channel.title: "This Won't Last" with Keith Rabois, Kevin Ryan, Logan Bartlett, and Zach Weinberg
channel.description: Sit in on Keith Rabois, Kevin Ryan, Logan Bartlett, and Zach Weinberg's monthly backchannel where they unpack their hottest takes on the future of tech, business, venture, investing, and politics. This Won't Last is part of the Turpentine podcast network. Learn more: www.turpentine.co

Sit in on Keith Rabois, Kevin Ryan, Logan Bartlett, and Zach Weinberg's monthly backchannel where they unpack their hottest takes on the future of tech, business, venture, investing, and politics.

This Won't Last is part of the Turpentine podcast network. Learn more: www.turpentine.co

item.title: VCs Debate: Tariffs, Taxation, Supply Chain | Keith Rabois, Logan Bartlett, Zach Weinberg, Kevin Ryan
item.description:
This is the fourth episode of This Won‚Äôt Last. The show is a monthly conversation between Logan Bartlett of Redpoint, Keith Rabois at Khosla Ventures, Kevin Ryan at Alleycorp, and Zach Weinberg at Operator Partners. This episode covers tech‚Äôs relationship with DC, entitlement spending, auto tariffs, the future of American politics, and more.
This Won't Last is part of the Turpentine podcast network. www.turpentine.co
--
ùïè¬†
https://twitter.com/thiswontlast
https://twitter.com/rabois
https://twitter.com/loganbartlett
https://twitter.com/kevinryan
https://twitter.com/zachweinberg
https://twitter.com/Redpoint
https://twitter.com/turpentinemedia
Check out the Logan Bartlett Show:¬† https://www.youtube.com/@theloganbartlettshow¬†
--
Timestamps:¬†
(00:00) Preview
(01:41) Go Knicks
(02:30) Pulse check: buyer's remorse?
(10:00) Fentanyl as a core focus
(16:11) Economic statecraft
(20:24) Pendulum swing for the Democrats?
(23:28) Energy prices and drilling policies
(29:43) Predictions on recession and midterm elections
(31:53) Market predictions
(32:50) Impact of tariffs, commitments, and tax cuts
(34:35) Debate on tax revenue and economic growth
(39:25) Entitlement spending and how to fix it
(42:05) How to get to 5% growth
(50:13) Trade, tariffs, and supply chains -- are we turning into Europe?
(56:00) Rare mineral supply
(59:00) China subsidizes the US consumers (like a tax cut)
(01:05:40) Tradecraft labor needs
(01:08:12) Wrap

item.title: Trump's Inauguration, Tech's Shifting Politics, and US GDP Growth Wall
item.description:
This is the third episode of This Won‚Äôt Last. This episode covers Silicon Valley's unprecedented attendance at Trump's inauguration, tech's evolving stance on energy and regulation, and why America's economy struggles to achieve the growth rates it saw from 1950-2000.
The show is a monthly conversation between Logan Bartlett of Redpoint, Keith Rabois at Khosla Ventures, Kevin Ryan at AlleyCorp, and Zach Weinberg, biotech founder (Curie.Bio) and investor.¬†¬†
This Won't Last is part of the Turpentine podcast network. www.turpentine.co -- ùïè¬† ‚Å†https://twitter.com/thiswontlast‚Å† ‚Å†https://twitter.com/rabois‚Å† ‚Å†https://twitter.com/loganbartlett‚Å† ‚Å†https://twitter.com/kevinryan‚Å† ‚Å†https://twitter.com/zachweinberg‚Å† ‚Å†https://twitter.com/Redpoint‚Å† ‚Å†https://twitter.com/turpentinemedia‚Å† --
Timestamps: (00:00) Intro (01:30) Keith‚Äôs bet with Nate Silver (04:31) Why its actually easy to predict election results (11:16) Trump‚Äôs character evolution (15:03) US GDP growth wall (16:31) Deportations in Trump‚Äôs presidency (21:36) H1B debate (23:50) Lessons for the Democrats from 2024 election (29:14) Altman, Zuckerberg, Dara, and others donating to inauguration (31:00) How Trump won over tech (35:10) The energy independence agenda (38:04) Keeping politics out of the workplace (43:52) How quickly DEI & meritocracy discourse has changed (46:10) Crime rates in New York (54:37) Drug stores across the country (55:45) Police response rates (57:48) Keith‚Äôs anecdotes from his prosecutor days (01:00:11) Insurance & California wildfires (01:04:03) Market forces & regulation
-- Recommended Podcast: Check out Modern Relationships, where Erik Torenberg interviews tech power couples and leading thinkers to explore how ambitious people actually make partnerships work. This season's guests include: Delian Asparouhov & Nadia Asparouhova, Kristen Berman & Phil Levin, Rob Henderson, and Liv Boeree & Igor Kurganov. Apple:¬†https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/id1786227593 Spotify:¬†https://open.spotify.com/show/5hJzs0gDg6lRT6r10mdpVg YouTube:¬†https://www.youtube.com/@ModernRelationshipsPod

item.content:encoded:
This is the third episode of This Won‚Äôt Last. This episode covers Silicon Valley's unprecedented attendance at Trump's inauguration, tech's evolving stance on energy and regulation, and why America's economy struggles to achieve the growth rates it saw from 1950-2000.


The show is a monthly conversation between Logan Bartlett of Redpoint, Keith Rabois at Khosla Ventures, Kevin Ryan at AlleyCorp, and Zach Weinberg, biotech founder (Curie.Bio) and investor.¬†¬†


This Won't Last is part of the Turpentine podcast network. www.turpentine.co

--

ùïè¬†

‚Å†https://twitter.com/thiswontlast‚Å†

‚Å†https://twitter.com/rabois‚Å†

(04:31) Why its actually easy to predict election results

(11:16) Trump‚Äôs character evolution

(15:03) US GDP growth wall

item.title: Inside OpenAI's First Venture Round (Khosla), AI Leaderboards, and Regulatory Chess Games
item.description:
This is the second episode of This Won‚Äôt Last. The show is a monthly conversation between Logan Bartlett of Redpoint, Keith Rabois at Khosla Ventures, Kevin Ryan at Alleycorp, and Zach Weinberg, biotech founder (Curie.Bio) and investor. This episode covers Khosla‚Äôs initial investment into OpenAI, runaway AI CapEx, long-term AI leaderboards, and regulatory implications in AI.
This Won't Last is part of the Turpentine podcast network. -- üôè¬†Help shape our show by taking our quick listener survey at https://bit.ly/TurpentinePulse. -- Subscribe on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@ThisWontLastpodcast https://www.youtube.com/@theloganbartlettshow -- ùïè https://x.com/thiswontlast https://x.com/rabois https://x.com/loganbartlett https://x.com/kevinryan https://x.com/zachweinberg https://x.com/Redpoint https://x.com/turpentinemedia
-- RECOMMENDED PODCAST: Check out Modern Relationships, where Erik Torenberg interviews tech power couples and leading thinkers to explore how ambitious people actually make partnerships work. Founders Fund's Delian Asparouhov and researcher Nadia Asparouhova kick off the series with an unfiltered conversation about their relationship evolution. Apple: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/id1786227593 Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/5hJzs0gDg6lRT6r10mdpVg YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@ModernRelationshipsPod -- Links:
OpenAI and Anthropic revenue data: https://www.tanayj.com/p/openai-and-anthropic-revenue-breakdown
Anthropic CEO on future $10B model: https://www.dwarkeshpatel.com/p/dario-amodei
Hardware costs in Scaling AI: https://fortune.com/2024/04/04/ai-training-costs-how-much-is-too-much-openai-gpt-anthropic-microsoft/
Comparing Quality/Speed/Price of AI models: https://artificialanalysis.ai/
CA banning election deep fakes on social media: https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/17/californias-5-new-ai-laws-crack-down-on-election-deepfakes-and-actor-clones/
Life expectancy relative to spending in Healthcare: https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/life-expectancy-vs-health-expenditure
-- Timestamps: (00:00) Intro (01:39) Show origins (02:39) OpenAI funding, Khosla‚Äôs initial investment (06:40) Talent shortage and power law engineers (11:47) Engineer tenure at startups (15:12) OpenAI metrics (19:26) AI CapEx (25:01) Zach‚Äôs Pixel vs iPhone (25:36) OpenAI vs Perplexity and Google (32:03) Safety concerns in AI (40:38) Misinformation regulation (46:38) Regulations in healthcare (48:44) Gambling regulations (58:49) Hidden downsides of regulations (01:03:59) Individual responsibilities (01:13:33) Closing

item.title: Is Founder Mode Insightful? Plus AI Valuations, Unrealized Gains Tax, and Putin's Telegram
item.description:
This is the debut episode of This Won‚Äôt Last, a monthly conversation between Logan Bartlett of Redpoint, Keith Rabois at Khosla Ventures, Kevin Ryan at Alleycorp, and Zach Weinberg, biotech founder (Curie.Bio) and investor. This episode covers Founder Mode, the state of VC fundraising, the potential for an unrealized gains tax, and Russia‚Äôs influence in Telegram.
This Won't Last is part of the Turpentine podcast network.
-- üôè¬†Help shape our show by taking our quick listener survey at https://bit.ly/TurpentinePulse. -- üé• Subscribe on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@ThisWontLastpodcast https://www.youtube.com/@theloganbartlettshow -- ùïè https://x.com/thiswontlast https://x.com/rabois https://x.com/loganbartlett https://x.com/kevinryan https://x.com/zachweinberg https://x.com/Redpoint https://x.com/turpentinemedia -- Links: Keith‚Äôs Recs:
High Output Management by Andy Grove
Keith Rabois‚Äô lecture notes from 2013: "How to Operate" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6fQHLK1aIBs
Tesla versus Edison: The Last Days of Night: A Novel by Graham Moore
Disruptive Innovation by Clayton M. Christensen
The Success Equation: Untangling Skill and Luck in Business, Sports, and Investing by Michael J. Mauboussin
Kevin‚Äôs Recs:¬†
Dark Wire by Joseph Cox
Logan‚Äôs Recs:
On railroads: Engines That Move Markets by Alistair Nairn
Wired: ‚ÄúThe Kremlin has entered your chat‚Äù
-- RECOMMENDED PODCAST: Check out Modern Relationships, where Erik Torenberg interviews tech power couples and leading thinkers to explore how ambitious people actually make partnerships work. Founders Fund's Delian Asparouhov and researcher Nadia Asparouhova kick off the series with an unfiltered conversation about their relationship evolution. Apple: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/id1786227593 Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/5hJzs0gDg6lRT6r10mdpVg YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@ModernRelationshipsPod -- TIMESTAMPS: (00:00) Intro (02:39) Kevin comes back from Burning Man (04:20) Paul Graham‚Äôs Founder Mode¬† (05:45) Founder mode intuitive for Keith, Pierre Lamond anecdote (07:00) Keith‚Äôs response to kernel of Founder Mode, Andy Grove High Output Management (08:28) What‚Äôs unique about Founder Mode? (09:13) Manager vs. Founder (12:57) Founder moral authority (15:00) Investing in founder driven CEOs (18:47) State of venture markets (21:15) Driverless car future (26:25) Revenue quality in AI valuations (33:00) New technology disruptive or helpful for incumbents (35:40) AI in Biotech (38:44) AI impacting fund AUM (42:30) AI as the transistor (43:25) Hurdle to return AI CapEx (44:30) Unrealized Capital Gains Tax (47:27) Sweden‚Äôs tax vs Norway and corporation tax rates (54:50) Medicare & Social Security, beneficial tax policies (1:00:45) Misleading life expectancy stats (1:02:15) Lina Khan, Antitrust effect on tech industry (1:10:20) Perplexity shocking Google (1:12:30) Pavel Durov and Russia‚Äôs Influence in Telegram (1:16:45) Not using TikTok and Telegram, risk in capital in Chinese companies (1:22:25) Closing -- Founders/CEOs/Execs of top companies can apply to join the Turpentine Network.

item.content:encoded:
This is the debut episode of This Won‚Äôt Last, a monthly conversation between Logan Bartlett of Redpoint, Keith Rabois at Khosla Ventures, Kevin Ryan at Alleycorp, and Zach Weinberg, biotech founder (Curie.Bio) and investor. This episode covers Founder Mode, the state of VC fundraising, the potential for an unrealized gains tax, and Russia‚Äôs influence in Telegram.


This Won't Last is part of the Turpentine podcast network.
